text: Beloved Life () is a 1953 West German drama film directed by Rolf Thiele and starring Ruth Leuwerik, Carl Raddatz and Albert Lieven.Bock & Bergfelder p.282 Following her husband's release from a prisoner of war camp in 1947, a woman remembers their lives together since the pre-First World War era. It was made at studios in Göttingen and on location in Hamburg. The film's sets were designed by Walter Haag and Erich Kutzner. ==Cast== * Ruth Leuwerik as Louise von Bolin * Carl Raddatz as Carl von Bolin * Albert Lieven as Joachim von Bolin * Maria Sebaldt as Imke von Bolin * Karl Ludwig Diehl as Oberst von Bolin * Horst Hächler as Benno von Bolin * Harry Meyen as Jürgen von Bolin * Eva Bubat as Auguste, Haushälterin ==References == == Bibliography == * Bock, Hans-Michael & Bergfelder, Tim. The Concise Cinegraph: Encyclopaedia of German Cinema. title: Beloved Life
